column2: review_text

Booked as we were attending Newmarket races Was easy and efficient from start to finish Double Sweet Room was clean comfortable and great value for money Staff were friendly and happily met all our requests Whilst we didn't use it the bar and food downstairs looked very enticing Would definitely stay here again both for convenience and value for money

Wonderful 4 star experience for 3 star price Great team great room luscious breakfast
Great touches such as loose clotheshangers charger for phone ironing board coffee making facilities and good location too

Another nice stay at this hotel comfy room easy check in and out and got chosen as guest of the day so couple extra perks Only let down on ordering the food which has worked well in the past Great location for train station parking and other amenities Staff friendly as ever

Great hotel, in a perfect location. Only stayed for one night but it was clean with friendly staff & we had an amazing homemade fresh pizza. Shout out to Dominic who was brilliant, happy & nothing was too much trouble. Keep up the good work.

Stayed at Ibis hotel 28 to 30 July and would go downstairs for my morning latte so wanted to say a special thank you to

Thank you Valentin for the wonderful latte and smile
He was polite and very attentive deliver a more personal touch to the service priceless

i would rate this 3 out of 4 but no more the location is good though being next to the station some rooms get noise from train announcements Double glazing and aircon meant that it was ok with windows closed though the rooms remained rather too warm overnight and this was in moderate weather Breakfast was good Rooms were clean and staff very helpful Like other reviewers we would have liked a room fridge. The decor is dated and the en suite shower room was an odd prefabricated pod with a mediocre shower flow fan permanently on and a noisy door Check in desk very oddly and awkwardly placed in bar area
This is not a budget hotel and as far as we could see not the cheapest for the location For the price we expected a bit more I would not rule out staying here again but I will probably try elsewhere next time

Lucília and Team make this cafe the most enjoyable, cosy, comfortable place in town! The service is 5 star, the atmosphere is great and the goodies delicious. A hidden gem in Cambridge with an excellent team in the perfect location, just next to the train station

You can actually see this hotel as you exit from the central station. It is also about a 15 minute walk into the central quarters of the city

Our room had creative interior decoration, a desk, comfortable beds and was clean. Bins for waste and recycling were provided in the hallway. A green policy was advertised for towels, but it appears all towels were changed anyway. There was no in-room safe, fridge, or gym. The reception kindly agreed to store some medication in their fridge.

Love this place! The food is always great food weather breakfast, lunch or dinner. All the drinks are fresh. Love the caramel iced latte. Staff always friendly, smiley and polite. Massive praise to Kelly by the counter! She is great and soo very helpful!

This hotel is in a great location next to the train station and a bunch of cafes and restaurants. It’s only a short walk into central Cambridge too.

The room was perfectly fine, cleaned every day and tea and coffee always topped up. The only ‘issue’ was the loud bathroom door which was problematic with a sleeping baby.

The staff really make this hotel. The check in, cleaning and cafe staff are all wonderful. The ladies in the cafe were particularly helpful with our baby providing entertainment and helping feed her (high chair and warming up food). Our baby was always so happy to see them too, so they must be good people ;-) unfortunately I didn’t get their names but one has a little sister called Luna :-)

Situated near the train station, bus station, and essential stores, this location is very easy and convenient. With reasonable prices, it remains quiet despite its proximity to the train station, thanks to the building's excellent architectural design that blocks out all noise.

Breakfast was pretty good, but the juice wasn’t nice at all, very weak. Hotel handy for the station, but quite a walk into town. Room was clean and tidy. But strange only having one bedside table! Bathroom was spotless. Staff were friendly.  There was some confusion over my Accor membership at check in. But was resolved.
Breakfast juice needs improvement.
Bottle of water in the room would have been appreciated.

Close to where I needed to be
Car parking
Our twin room was spacious. The public areas are comfortable. Great onsite cafe/bar with 10% off for residents. Recommend the salads and pizzas. Lovely staff. Great location for transport links.
Situation
No teabags only herbal no biggy
Location is superb. Right next to the train station and near to amenities. Approx 1-1.5m walk to river and punts. Rooms are clean and big enough, but not massive.

The location is great for the station, easy to get a taxi into the centre of the city.
Good choice for breakfast, lots of it.
Staff friendly and polite.
The sausages and mushrooms were not great.

Location
Check process was very poor - took 30 minutes due to issues with PDA and couldn’t pay cash as cashless!

Great location & friendly staff. Special mention for Dominic who was great at his job looking after everyone.
Shower was ok & could have been better.

Best hot chocolate with lovely and great customer service by Vero. We stopped in the afternoon, the place was calm and peaceful!!! We will definitely come back again!! Had a very nice experience here :) highly recommend to anyone coming to Cambridge.

A very comfortable, friendly and convenient hotel close to station. We were visiting Cambridge four four nights by train and were looking for a fairly central spot to stay. The Ibis was ideal. Close to station might sound a bad choice but not in Cambridge. The station square has some of the ambience of a pedestrian piazza. Several cafes, a Sainsburys and a bar / pizzeria present in the Ibis and next door. There is a very small reception area where we were welcomed warmly and efficiently. There is a bar reastaurant and a fairly small lounge area (with occasional live music) And upstairs a large breakfast room with excellent varieties of foods and beverages. The rooms are fairly typical Ibis , small but beds are vry comfortable with pillows to enjoy! The ensuite toilets and showers were in "pods" within the roome and were interesting . I would note that there is a mall step up (two inches or so ) to get into the ensuite which was a bit of a surprise when I went to visit at night half asleep. I dont know if anyone has ever tripped on this!. The staff were fantastic with personality and humour. Thank them all! Great stay in convenient reasonably priced hotel!

I’m a repeater customer here. The staff are friendly (personally thanks especially to Vero:)) and very welcoming. It’s also very accessible, right in front of the train station and bus stops to the city centre are close by. I’ll visit here from time to time and recommend this place to others!

Great location at the station, friendly service from all staff, clean room and facilities, best breakfast and very tasty pizzas, very good coffee and whatever else you want to drink, close to stop for hop-on hop-off bus, 20 minute walk from town.

We chose this hotel for a 1x night stay on 07 June 2024. Its location is excellent if arriving by train. It is also great for getting into the city. The staff are friendly and helpful.

The rooms was a good size and very clean and functional. The biggest surprise was the fantastic breakfast on offer which we enjoyed. Overall a very pleasing stay and would highly recommend. Thanks Ibis.

Really nice place, good food and professional service. Melisa and Filipa were very kind and friendly for us. It is worth going. They serve good breakfast and delicious Ecuadorian hot chocolate with whipped dream. You can have breakfast here for a good start of the day.

We came for dinner and were served by Kelly, Inês, and Filipa. As always, the customer service was exemplary- they not only made us feel welcome as usual (we are regulars) but were incredibly attentive while dealing with an impressive workload! I can only say that they all deserve a raise and are brilliant staff. The IBIS is lucky to have such an impressive crew and I hope will recognise this. Special shout-out to Melissa as well who was not serving tonight but is a superstar and has been a key to making our previous visits so smooth.

Coming with our friends here for breakfast.
Portion is quite big, we loved the fresh food and coffee. Great vibes!

Melissa and Filipa are very kind and helpful! Had a very nice experience here :) highly recommend to anyone coming to Cambridge.

Coming with our friends here for breakfast.
Portion is quite big, we loved the fresh food and coffee. Great vibes!

Melissa and Filipa are very kind and helpful! Had a very nice experience here :) highly recommend to anyone coming to Cambridge.
Great location close to the train station, very clean, friendly, helpful and responsive team. Highly recommend.
Car parking option near the hotel is expensive, no discount as a hotel guest
Excellent breakfast.

Location was perfect and cafe/bar area was great!
Very comfortable room with great air con.
Fab breakfast, all fresh and so much choice.
Coffee and tea facilities weren’t adequate for two people.

Room adequate everything we needed. Breakfast was a little disapponting. Although location was ok it was easy enough to get transport to town centre.
Breakfast. Replenishing the empty trays was slow and one morning no fresh orange, so substituted with diluting juice.

Staff was very friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable and cozy. It was reasonable location
Lack of hair conditioner, toilets door too noisy to open or close looking like a plane toilets. Could do with a small lounge table and chairs. Only one chair present.

Great for train travel but a bit of a walk from the city. Otherwise nothing to complain about. Staff were lovely
Not a lot

Location and bar area
No iron in the room

Convenient, cleanliness, staff patient and good service
No refrigerator provided seems not good for customer’s cold food storage like yogurt.
Close to the station. Very quiet. Cades and pubs nearby

Kelly Antia is bubbly, friendly very helpful, efficient and has excellent customer service. She made us feel very welcome and comfortable and helped us with our choice of pizza. We
would definitely recommend this place for pizza. Kate and Basil xx

Val was an excellent Waiter, made me and my friends feel welcome and made sure any issues we had were sorted! Overall in my opinion val is the best waiter.

I would definitely recommend this place to other people it’s great for coffee and pizza or just catching up with friends.

We are regulars at the Ibis in Cambridge. Our daughter lives here so we visit frequently. The team at the Ibis are always very helpful and welcoming. A special shout out to two of them, the wonderful Melissa in the bar who could not be more helpful and friendly and the equally wonderful Susana in reception. They always remember us when we come to stay and the level of service they provide is phenomenal. Thanks to both of them and their fellow excellent colleagues for making us feel so welcome and our regular stays so enjoyable. Thanks from Andy and Jane Heyn

It's always a nice experience to spend time in the cafe at ibis Cambridge. It is a nice place with a wide variety of food, drinks, coffee and pleasant staff. Huge thanks to Melissa and Antia for their hospitality and smiles. They always make our day!

We chose this place because it was well located for train travel and it had a good price. Do note that it is a little bit out of town. Its a longish walk or a bus ride in. However, you get exactly what you expect for an Ibis. Because I'm a hotel member, I was able to store my luggage when I arrived early. The front desk staff were having to do a lot of explaining to other people that this facility wasn't an option open to them unless they joined the loyalty scheme.

Hotel is convenient to several cafes if you're not having breakfast in house.

Room was fine, compact as Ibis always is but with everything needed there. Surprisingly, given the hotel was full, it was actually pretty quiet so slept well. Only annoying thing was a fluoro light constantly flickering so we had to turn it off.

Otherwise, a good stay with good value for money and very convenient to the train the next day.

The room was clean and modern and excellent location for the train station. I would like a fridge in the room and the ability to order room service from downstairs instead of going down to the bar. Staff aren’t the friendliest. Also think the tea and coffee facilities could be improved in the room, especially for the price you pay.

Very convenient as its near the train station. Check in was good. The Rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff, Filipa, Ines and Antia are very friendly and attentive. Took me a while to decide what i wanted to drink and Filipa was offering suggestions patiently. Food and drinks are good.

My friend just arrived cambridge yesterday, I took her walk around cambridge and we took a break and spent sometime and chatting in Chill#2 cafe, we ordered one latte and one mocha the price kind of expensive but it was fine, the area was very chill as same as the coffee shop name, also we met two very kind and polite staff which is Val and Melissa. Both of them gave us a warm welcome with big smile, Melissa also made both of us very pretty and taste very smooth latte with pretty latte art and smooth Mocha with a lot chocolate powder on top. We will definitely come here again!!

Today the weather is a very good, stopped by this coffee shop ordered latte, enjoyed the time, the latte was very good with a pretty heart serviced by Melissa. The coffee shop environment was very chill, other staff were very nice as well. I absolutely go to coffee shop again.

By the Rail station, great location, clean rooms, lovely and kind staff, especially Kelly on the bar and lady at the reservation desk. We have arrived a bit early before our check in time but she happily helped us. Happy hours on Friday and Saturday at 17:00-19:00 on bar area.

Couldn’t be more convenient for the railway station; food and drink options on the doorstep but only a short walk away from some nice pubs and cafes on Mill Road.
Quite expensive for one night without breakfast, but probably our fault for staying in graduation week (we didn’t know when we booked!)

We liked the location, the beds, and seatings in the bedroom, which allowed us to put things separately. The decor is new and clean. The hotel offered luggage storage after checking out if you are registered as an Accord member. The reception was very helpful.
The carpet is a bit dark, which makes the room dark even with lights on. The bathroom is a bit small but it's OK for our one night stay.
Breakfast

Clean , safety
Price was high

Overall was good
Bathrooms are not the best, it feels like train toilet cabin but with a shower

The breakfast buffet spread was good, at an extra cost. The location was good, right next to the railway station.
There was ample parking around, because the hotel is at the railway station. However, there was no free parking for hotel guests, and parking charges were quite steep.

The staff were really friendly and helpful with my queries. The room was quiet and outside noise was barely heard. My room was comfortable and the wi-fi worked without issue. It is conveniently located next to the station and has some food places to eat if you do not want to eat in their café. I really liked the café as a place to relax when I was not outside.
The bathroom is small with the bathroom door having a gap underneath but for one person it was OK.
Nice clean central hotel
We appreciated the location near the train station.

Great Location, Clean, compact but functional.
Friendly helpful staff. Free bag drop facility.
Very uncomfortable bed. Obviously this is a matter of opinion but for reference my partner and I are about 5'10" and about 10 stone, side sleepers. Only 1 pillow each which although large was like a brick once compacted. We usually like a firm mattress but this bed was very hard with a 1" mattress topper in an attempt to mitigate the hard divan style bed but you could still feel hard ridges in the mattress through it. There was no point complaining as we were only staying one night.

No idea why there are not more complaints about Ibis 'sweet' beds so maybe we just got unlucky....

Melissa is a nice waitress and I enjoyed the time there ! And the food was so good , I ordered a hot chocolate with a chocolate bread and an avocado toast and I enjoyed everything in addition the place it was in a calm environment and so peaceful!! I love it and I will definitely come back again

We stayed at the hotel with 12 colleagues. The arrangements made beforehand were handled very efficiently and the responses were quick. The meeting room was well-equipped with a screen and refreshments, including coffee, tea, water, and delicious cake. The rooms are spacious, with very comfortable beds and pillows. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast offered a wide variety of choices and was excellent.

I’d not stayed in an Ibis hotel before. The room I had was of a reasonable size with a comfortable bed, practical desk and chair and plenty of storage. There was air con though I did not need it. The only feature of the room I did not like was the bathroom pod. Whilst perfectly serviceable, it was rather cramped in contrast to the rest of the room and I was woken one night by the sound of water gushing and bubbling up underneath the shower as if it was backing up/overflowing. I was worried what I’d find in there in the morning - though actually it was fine.

Breakfast in the hotel was perfectly good with plenty of choice. I particularly liked the diced fresh

A gem of a coffee shop hidden in plain sight!
The cafe on the ground floor of this hotel is right on station square. The staff are wonderful. Friendly, attentive and great at their coffee craft (not common in hotel cafes).
The place has a lovely chilled vibe.
Anita and Vero have been fab today!

Great hotel, stayed for a business trip. Great location - next to train station. Lovely coffee shop/bar on bottom floor. Staff were great at all times and room was clean and quiet. Beds were comfortable and had a nice view. Breakfast - there were plenty of options and was nice. Thanks for a lovely stay and I would definitely return in the future when I visit Cambridge.

We just spend a lovely afternoon at chill#2 bar.. we just wanted a quick snack but end up spending the whole afternoon there,beautiful pizza,salad and tasty cake to finish it up.. everything was fantastic..Ines who served us was amazing.. Thank you very much!

Really great space and atmosphere.Lovely coffee and food. Cafe staff are really friendly and approachable - Filipa who served us today was fantastic! Fantastic place to work, catch up with friends or wind down from a long day. Will be coming here again soon!!

I had the pleasure of visiting Ibis cafe and was warmly welcomed by Melissa. Her friendly demeanor and attention to detail made my visit exceptional. Melissa's service was prompt, and her smile made the atmosphere even more inviting. I'll definitely be back!

Melissa is a very friendly and kind person. She serves very well and is also extremely organized. This is because she always gives me the food as fast as possible. She is always smiling and always cheerful. Melissa is also from Hong Kong so I feel very welcomed.

Tammin and the staff was great. This is our second stay and made us feel very welcome. Tammin particularly delivered great customer service and went the extra mile. Her pizzas are the best, and made sure we were well looked after. Looking forward to our next visit
Very convenient to the train station
plenty of good quality food nearby

Room, location, local shops, efficiency (check-in; departure)
Limited choice in in-house catering

Super convenient location. Near transport and centre, near shops and restaurants for food.
Facilities and hotel bar were great but could have had access to hair dryer and iron. Maybe can request at desk but info was not provided

Great location, right outside the train station. The breakfast was a great price at £13.50 pp. Clean and comfortable rooms. The downstairs bar had live music on Saturday night which was a nice atmosphere.
The airconditioner was broken and the station announcements were too loud to be able to sleep with the window open so the room temperature was quite warm.

Well situated on Station Square. Literally just a stone's throw from the main entrance to Cambridge's main station.

Plenty of buses and taxis so it is very easy to get the short distance into the city centre, where we needed to be for our daughter's graduation.

Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice.

Well situated on Station Square. Literally just a stone's throw from the main entrance to Cambridge's main station.

Plenty of buses and taxis so it is very easy to get the short distance into the city centre, where we needed to be for our daughter's graduation.

Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice.
Very clean and functional rooms - AC worked well, blackout blinds too. Quiet.
The beds are clean and comfortable, the staff are very helpful and the breakfast is excellent.

Clean comfortable room that was cheaper than many for the date (during graduation week at the university). Conveniently next to the station and very good buffet breakfast with plenty of vegan options.
Station announcements in the evening could be heard if you were a light sleeper - OK for us.
Tammin has been fantastic with her customer service , she really pays attention to details and always goes the extra mile to help with any issues. Big bonus is she makes the best pizzas

Nice hotel and very clean, Hollie made the stay much more enjoyable with her personality and customer service but was only working on our first night of the stay,

Unfortunately we had the pleasure of the 2 guys on nights for 2 nights who to be quite honest can't cook a pizza to save their lives, sorry guys but it's true, maybe a training issue or they just don't give poo,

I wasn't a paying guest with the hotel but a passer-by who was in a midst of panic,a sense of erency a stress heaache and 4% battery charge... I dropped in to ask a if they had a charger. The reception manager went above and beyond! Thanks a million

We stayed with a whole schoolclass for three nights. Ibis booked us all in rooms next to each other, which was very good, and easy for us teachers, to organize with our pupils.
The staff was brilliant with our group. Thank you so much for taking care of us in your warm way. We had a great time at Ibis, and many of us really enjoyed the very nice breakfast.

The rooms are clean, the food is good and Ella tended to all our needs.

Breakfast was included each morning and it was delicious. I think that the only thing that was missing from pur rooms was a fridge. It would be nice if they could add a fridge with some beverages.

Comfortable room next to the station and good location for all major attractions by 10 minute walk. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby as well. Our room had all the facilities required, check in was easy and staff were very friendly. The only negative was that throughout our stay there was a buzzing sound which was constantly heard from our bedroom on the 4th floor which made sleeping a bit of a problem. Not entirely sure if this is some sort of generator, fortunately we were only staying for 2 nights otherwise this would have been a major issue.

Perfect location near the train station, nice if you have an early flight to catch. We arrived before check-in opened but if you registered on their website you got free early check-in. The hotel didn't offer any surprises, small room and tiny bathroom, but you already knew that when you booked. Perfect.

Well positioned hotel within easy walking distance of city centre. Plenty of cafes, bars, restaurants right outside including a little sainsburys and M&S food at the train station. Room was very clean with all you could need. On first arrival, we thought it was really quiet, which it was until we tried going to sleep and then realised the air con unit/ some kind of mechanical noise from above the room was actually quite noisy. Nonetheless, the staff were all very friendly, helpful and the breakfast was plentiful and delicious, in pleasant surroundings. Would definitely stay again if coming to Cambridge.
We had dinner in the bar/ restaurant next door which was also very good.

As far as hotels go, this place is excellent for its close proximity to the train station in Cambridge. Quirky interiors, welcoming and friendly check in staff. Rooms are clean, bright, and comfortable. Definitely recommend the Ibis for a Cambridge stay.

Very good team member staf. Workers are very polite and caring. Clean rooms and breakfast. Perfect location for a visit to Cambridge, every necessity nearby. The reception team was very receptive and helpful. Delicious breakfast served by Olga.

We had a great time at the bar with the Queen Bee Blues Band live music! Bea and her band offer great entertainment and great music. We really enjoyed the relaxed and informal vibes and the bar has food and drinks. Well done Lucilia &team for organising these events!!

Location. Room
No bath

Most things.
Bathroom door hard to close due to catch spring being too stiff. When closing, lots of force required which shook the room. Other rooms had the same design problem.
Friendly helpful staff

Great breakfast, nice looking, and a convenient spot.
We asked for an extra bed when we booked and they said it would be provided in advance, but they didn’t have any available when we arrived.
Breakfast

Close to rail and easy walk to city centre
Bit noisy

Convenient location and comfy beds. We’ll come again!
You have to sign up to some program to leave your luggage for a few hours after checking out. It’s free but cumbersome…
Clean and functional
I didn't have the included breakfast, but the food in the café downstairs was good and it was a good place to catch up on some pre-meeting work. The coffee was particularly excellent.

Had an evening meal. Pizza was good
The two for the price of one could be mix and match as long as there is no price difference there ought to be able to change.

We had a great time at the bar with the Queen Bee Blues Band live music! Bea and her band offer great entertainment and great music. We really enjoyed the relaxed and informal vibes and the bar has food and drinks. Well done Lucilia &team for organising these events!!

This morning I dropped my partner to the station and we have often stopped in for a coffee. Well never again after the appalling service and cold watery coffee. First off the waitress taking the order did not apply the offer advertised and we very politely asked if she could rectify it. She seemed pretty annoyed and gave a distinct eye roll.
We then we waited 15 minutes and had not received our order. I noticed the waitresses chit chatting and our coffees remained cold by the machine. When my partner asked for our coffees explaining he had a train to catch the server exchanged very obvious smirks with the person she was chatting with (not sure if she worked there but the whole thing was unprofessional ) and gave us our by now cold coffees. Very unpleasant attitude and cold coffee. Thanks for ruining my morning. Will not return.

Great service indeed, nice and peaceful environment with all essential facilities! Thanks Lucilia!

The café area is really peaceful and great place to grab a coffee and work! Food is also really good, try the pizzas, they're really good!!

Stayed here with my partner. Very welcoming staff, clean room and bathroom. Absolutely nothing wrong with anything here. They have great free WiFi and a good menu of food with a bar and café downstairs. Let us leave our luggage there for the day after we checked out for free which was so helpful. Definitely would come back if I was visiting again

Our son was super happy to find this handmade train station on our arrival in the room as welcome gift . A special thanks to Leo, Susanna and Shivani for this amazing surprise! Thanks to the Ibis Cambridge Team to make us feel at home. Great location and services.

At the restaurant, Lucilia and her team treated us perfectly, we went with a large group and they did nothing but help us. The food was very delicious and abundant, and always on time. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner there and it was really great. I recommend it.`

Very welcoming, friendly reception team. Clean, comfortable room and very quiet despite the central location (I was worried it would be noisy and it was one of the quietest hotels I have been to recently). I would stay there again. Only change I would make would be to have marmelade with chunky orange pieces rather than the one they had for breakfast - everything else was great.

A welcoming, easy stay, with a great cafe and a great room. A lovely touch was being given a flower for international women's day. I actually ate in the cafe, first time ever at a hotel cafe. Lovely welcoming staff, and a really comfy, well designed room. Good value, too, given I booked last minute.

This hotel is right by the train station so very conveniently located with buses very close to take you to the city centre or a 1 mile walk into town. There’s a handy Sainsbury’s next door and some eateries.
The staff was helpful on check in. We didn’t eat at the hotel. The room was small (we were 3 people) but clean. The bathroom was cramped and weirdly shaped (and whitewashed) like the cylindrical toilets on trains. Our sink was stained which was a bit off-putting.
But other than that, cheap and cheerful and so if you’re looking for a budget stay, you can’t really go wrong.

Very central, right next to the station. Lovely decor, beautiful bar and sitting area. Friendly reception staff. Lovely room, nice bathroom pod and area for clothes. Ironing board and iron which was very handy.
The water pressure in the shower wasn’t that great in the morning and it wasn’t that hot. There could have been a couple of biscuits added to the welcome tray. There could also be more power points as there seemed to be only two where we could plug in charging devices.
Parking very pricey
Very good for overnight stay or weekend

The breakfast was alright
Hot breakfast wasn't that hot more like cold

Room was nice but a little smaller than expected
The sheet was dirty and had to get changed.
No drinking water in the room
The staff are amazing! Efficient and very nice. They treat their customers well - which is rare these days.

Great location and far better than expected for a 3 star billing. Rooms were basic but comfortable and functional. Breakfast selections was good and I liked the 'wasted food yesterday' sign on the entrance to the breakfast room. I also liked the ground floor café area for working.
There wasn't anything not to like. More than met my expectations and I will stay again for sure.
The food and lounge area

Quiet room fairly central and close to the station at a good price for central Cambridge.
A small fridge would have made the room perfect.

Clean rooms,helpful and friendly staff and good location near the train station
Nothing

Excellent option to stay in Cambridge. The system is a little particular since, instead of having a typical reception, you have hotel staff on the ground floor who checks you in and assigns you the room. But it is an effective and agile system that poses no problems. As for the hotel, it is modern, new, with spacious and clean rooms, without carpet and with a very comfortable bed. The location is, in my opinion, good. Next to the train station, allowing you to leave your suitcase as soon as you arrive, and about 10/15 minutes walk from the center of Cambridge in a pleasant walk. The surroundings of the hotel and the station are very good, with restaurants, a supermarket and office buildings. And all this at a reasonable price, taking into account the high prices you find in Cambridge. Come on, in my opinion, a highly recommended option.

This is without doubt one of the best ibis hotels I have stayed in.
Great location next door to the station and a warm welcome at reception.
As a gold member, the Christmas card and complimentary sweets in the room were very much appreciated.
Reasonably spacious rooms, super clean.
Nice cafe/bar area on the ground floor.

Very conveniently located, a welcoming and comfortable modern hotel right next to the station, buses and taxis.

We spent two nights here and were quite pleased with it. Staff were helpful and the room rate was competitive - unlike other hotels in Cambridge

There was also a great choice at Breakfast in a breakfast room on the 2st floor overlooking the station square

A few confusions at check-in, but otherwise everything was okay. The 5the floor room was good with a nice view of Cambridge. I liked the closeness to the railway station. Breakfast was typical for an Ibis and enjoyable. I'd be happy to stay here in the future.

Excellent mid range hotel next to the train station. The staff were all really friendly and welcoming, we were able to check in early which was a nice touch, the room was clean and modern, great buffet breakfast, and good value. Wouldn't hesitate to return.

We booked our work Christmas party. Lucilia was a great host, she planned our Christmas party to the detail, welcoming and very attentive to the group. Quick to find a way we could have music and we indeed had lots of fun. Staff very friendly and helpful. Space is cool too. Live music splendid! Only thing I could say for improvement in the future is to speed up process of delivering food to the table as it was a little cold.

We booked our work Christmas party. Lucilia was a great host, she planned our Christmas party to the detail, welcoming and very attentive to the group. Quick to find a way we could have music and we indeed had lots of fun. Staff very friendly and helpful. Space is cool too. Live music splendid! Only thing I could say for improvement in the future is to speed up process of delivering food to the table as it was a little cold.

This hotel is a gem in Cambridge. Right next to the station it’s super convenient if you’re visiting- and it’s only a 10 minute walk into the town centre. There are great bars and restaurants on station square.
The Chill02 cafe in the ground floor of the Ibis is super. AMAZING breakfast

Excellent service. Always friendly, polite and helpful staff, great food and snacks. I would recommend Ibis to anyone visiting Cambridge.
The facilities are very clean and comfortable. There is also live music in the cafe on weekends.

Convenient for the station, less so for city centre (20 min walk or 5 min bus ride). Staff very pleasant and helpful. Informal check in without a reception area worked ok. Pleasant cafe to sit in on ground floor (definitely above usual standard for hotels of this level). There are some other pleasant cafes nearby too. Room adequate - a bit shabby but clean (they need to redecorate soon), also rather noisy as the internal insulation is not great. Price on a Monday in November was a bit high for what one gets - if you have to pay £100 its worth looking for an alternative in the town centre. Otherwise the only complaint was that I left my phone charger in my room and by the time I came back to collect it a few hours later it had disappeared, presumably thrown away by the cleaning staff - poor service.

Very good selection
Everything was fine

It was close to the station. The hotel has a bar which is open long hours.
It was a long walk to the centre of Cambridge. However the guided bus goes to the centre.

The functionality of the accommodation, only what you needed.

Nothing was a bother, extra tea/coffee at reception if needed.

The option to skip daily room service worked well.
No draws but managed without, so it's not a real problem.

Convenient location next to train station.
Easy check in and checkout.
Clean.
Simple and no hassle.
Friendly staff.

Great location, friendly staff, good facilities.
The bathroom had a step at the entrance that could catch people out if they weren't careful.
service is so good ! and the room is very clean ~!
Quick check in, great location close to station and city centre.

Excellent location within a minute of the station. Comfortable, efficient room.
Public spaces are quite small - not a hotel to lounge around in all day, but that's hardly what one would do anyway.

Location is good, right next to the station. Staffs are very friendly, rooms are very clean. Food trucks and taxi next by the front door.
Parking isn’t free, so hard to stop there to unload / load the luggage.

Location
The shower

We loved our stay. Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, very good breakfast. Great location, near the train station, near a convenience store, walking distance to many restaurants and pubs. We are planning to visit Cambridge again and we will definitely book here again.

There was a really good atmosphere at the hotel. we also really enjoyed the pizza in the restaurant too. Breakfast room is also very bright and welcoming. Rooms were very clean and perfect for a short weekend break.

Standard ibis hotel but staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were a large group, check in was fast and very efficient. Bar and food offering was standard but service was great. All in all if you are looking for a launch pad to explore Cambridge this place is perfect.
got put into a tiny inside room with no view whatsoever asked tochange but was refused and there must have been some empty outside rooms bathroom very small breakfast ok but wouldn.y stay there again

This would is a fairly typical contemporary Ibis conveniently located adjacent to the railway station, but a 20-minute walk, or a 5-minute bike ride into the CBD. Reasonably-priced for the UK, this property does not have any serious issues, but we hated the lack of a proper reception desk for check-in. Uncomfortably, we felt we were always in the way in front of someone trying to navigate within the hotel. This is especially awkward when we or other patrons had baggage on hand. What was management thinking?! The friendly employees here on more than one occasion expressed the dislike of the lack of a reception area. Otherwise, it delivers on the basics: cleanliness throughout, good room temperature controls, noise levels under control, reasonably comfortable bed, good toilet pressure and water temperature controls in the bathroom, sufficient supply of towels, nice lighting options in the room, enough electrical outlets to charge your piles of modern junk, workable wi-fi, competent housekeeping, and friendly and helpful staff. Having breakfast buffet over the station plaza was nice.

The hotel was so lovely, the staff were friendly and they even did a special towel arrangement and supplied a cake for my boyfriend’s 21st! The free welcome drink was also very thoughtful. The bedroom was very clean.

Very stylish hotel conveniently located next to Cambridge train station with many restaurants nearby. The historical centre is less than 30-min walk. The check-in out process is efficient and smooth. The room is clean, spacious and the bed comfortable in a cozy quiet atmosphere. It would be perfect if the hotel ant least offers some basic gym facilities. Overall I enjoyed this one night stay and will recommend this hotel definitely.

I arrived in Cambridge, having stayed at an over priced too cool for school hotel where my room was so small I couldn't open my suitcase!

I was welcomed at the hotel and quickly given my key cards. No waiting. no queues!

I went straight to my room and found it to be very clean, bright and completely functional. It had everything I needed. Very important for me, my room was completely silent. No noise from other guests.

Breakfast was good. No nonsense.

The stay was fantastic and represented great value for money.

Great well priced and well positioned if you need to get the train to newmarket for the horses. Also vicinity wise 10 minutes walk to the left there is the leisure complex with restaurants, cinema and bowling. then straight infront main high street into centre with loads of pubs and restaurants. Hotel Staff were also really welcoming and friendly.

Car parking out the front and cost us £37.50 from 2pm Friday until we left at 11am on Sunday. Their 24 hour period starts from 4am in the morning which means having to pay more than a normal hourly car park. Closest one so no real choice.

Also last thing watch out driving to hotel as our sat nav took us down a bus only lane which we didn't know we were entering until after we went through it as too busy concentrating looking for the car park and not the signs.

Great value for money
Excellent location
Clean and tidy....so it was outside around the hotel and station.
Noise from station is minimal
Staff were friendly and helpful.
Room was good.
Bed was sooooo comfy
Great night's sleep
Breakfast, was a great selection to suit all tastes and needs
Would definitely stay here again

Baby cot was really great . Breakfast is nice. Very affordable.
Super tiny room. Bathrooms are really not spacious.
Good location
The hotel location was perfect ,so near to the station and buses

The staff. Breakfast ok for the price (12£ pp).
Small bathroom and little place do put the clothes. A bit far from the centre.
Nice staff
Different, clean and good location

Staff were very efficient, polite and informative
When we opened the window all we could hear was the train station

Clean modern and well located with friendly staff
No hand towels in the bedroom and very bright lighting
comfortable clean room, breakfast was good and the staff were helpfull

Location and quietness
Bed hard , expensive

This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. I often find the Ibis hotels to be too basic, but this was a pleasant exception.

The reception staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was small, but very clean and functional. There was even a place to put your suitcase on.

The bed was very comfortable and spacious. The partially open closet was practical and thanks to the shelves, it was easy to put clothes there.

There was even a desk, also with power outlets. The water boiler would benefit from a good cleaning and descaling.

The bathroom was small, but also very clean. The one thing was the water pressure. This was totally inadequate, both from the faucet, as well as the shower. Guests with long hair, better think twice before using shampoo. It may take a long time to get rid of it.

I did notify the reception about this, and it was said that somebody would take a look at it, but I did not notice any difference. Maybe it is just the way it is.

The breakfast buffet was a pleasant surprise. Lots of choices and it was kept well stocked.

Altogether I've had a good stay in this hotel.

Lovely short stay here. Really good hotel. Location was really convenient and The staff were lovely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and fresh, with some nice touches. Cafe downstairs was nice place to spend some time. To be recommended.

The restaurant staff are helpful and kind and respond to guests’ requests with pleasure, especially the female employee who works hard and does not hesitate to fulfill requests. We wish her more seriousness and diligence.

Ines, tania, Joana and Olga prepared us amazing diner every day, the food was very good. Made us feel like we were at home. It was amazing being at ibis Cambridge. Thank you so much for the excellent service.

The room was fine, although the bathroom was a bit small. There was no noise from outside (we were on the 5th floor, facing inwards)
Breakfast was quite good, but it was busy and tables were not being cleaned and food was not being replaced after it had run out (we had to point it out to the staff)

We had a fantastic time at the ibis Cambridge Central Station. The staff was friendly, and the breakfast was delicious. Lucília was incredible and made sure that we had all we needed for a pleasant stay. Thank you! We will definitely return and highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed for one night. They accommodated us for a late check-in which was nice. Room was what was expected: clean, simple, but up to standards and comfy. The toilet stopped working (water wouldn't stop running) so the lady who was doing the night shift came to fix it and it was fixed quickly. Only thing is that when we showered the entire bathroom floor got wet. Check out was quick and easy. The location was great: a few steps away from the station, a taxi stand right outside, bus links and a walk into the city. A very convenient hotel for a quick Cambridge stay.

Special thanks to the staff and especially Ola! The bed is comfortable and the room was quiet. The restaurant is also suited and convenient for business trips. The proximity to the rail station and the bus lines to city center is a real plus.

Great location, next to train station and very close to the centre. great breakfast with lots of vegan options. Rooms are ok for a 3 star hotels. Very poor wifi that made quite difficult working from the hotel.

A very pleasant stay in a small but efficient room. The train station area has a lot of good options including a couple of excellent food trucks. It does seem to be a "cool" hangout area and music below,but just until 10 or so. It was about 6 pounds to Uber to the heart of the city. Would definitely stay again.

It was really lovely and we were welcomed with a big smile as we came in by a lovely lady who made us feel so comfortable! She was so cheery and sweet and it made us feel at ease!
There was nothing wrong with it!

Great location
Single beds far too small more like occasional guest beds or extra children’s beds

The breakfast was lovely, and location was fantastic
After storing our bags and dress (evening outfit) on its hanger/bag. My dress and jacket smelt very bad of Indian food. So bags were stored near kitchen.
Shower wasn’t powerful.

It was very clean and in a very good location for the train station and the city centre
Beds were a bit uncomfortable and the room was too hot despite turning the temperature right down.

Location and facilities were great
TV remote wasn't working and took a while to get fixed but after that everything was fine.

Good
Bathroom door didn’t close , felt very cramped

Location great. Room clean. Facilities fine. Lovely female singer in lobby as I arrived.
Normally you get a biscuit or something with your tea/coffee set. Bed was very hard, which I don’t mind but prob not everyone’s cup of tea. Shower wasn’t very powerful and only managed to get to a warm temperature. Price for one night seemed quite high. Initially was going to come with hubbie who unfortunately had to work - v disappointed that there was little difference in price from two people to one.
Modern and clean

Location. Bright and fresh.
Expensive.
Location and breakfast room view

The room was comfortable and clean and had everything that we needed. The staff were friendly and welcoming. I liked the fact that we could choose not to have our room cleaned every day...we can make the beds and wash up cups and dry the towels off. The only thing I would say would have been handy, would have been to have had a socket both sides of the bed?

The room was comfortable and clean and had everything that we needed. The staff were friendly and welcoming. I liked the fact that we could choose not to have our room cleaned every day...we can make the beds and wash up cups and dry the towels off. The only thing I would say would have been handy, would have been to have had a socket both sides of the bed?

Couldn't have been a better experience, the staff without exception were incredibly friendly and helpful the second we walked in the door. The wines in the bar were lovely, as was all the food, and the room was perfect with a very comfortable bed and well-appointed bathroom. Would not hesitate to return again.

This was a wonderful stay.

Location- Located in a lively hub right next to the train station we expected a noisey night but we didn't hear anything within the hotel! You can hear hustle and bustle outside but only if you choose to sleep with the windows open.
20mins walk into the centre or plenty of taxis as you step out of the hotel.
Staff- brilliant from welcome, cafe and departure. We noted it was our anniversary and received a personalised welcome in our room.
Room- very clean and comfy
Breakfast- lots of choice and replenished often

Would definitely recommend and return if we visit Cambridge again.

Convenient (in the square next to the Rail Station), and near a lot of bus routes). Basic but comfortable rooms and beds. Excellent breakfast (British and Continental styles). Good bathroom with adequate shower.

to begin with, make a claim that there are no exaggeration. great services, all the workers are trying their best to help and solve ur problems. great experience in Cambridge . especially shout out to Ms. Ola K and another lady cooperate with her, very kind and respect customers , always being positive. helps me a lot. thank all the workers efforts and leads to a fantastic experience. definitely worth the price，strongly recommended.

This is an excellent, no-frills hotel. It's located right next to the train station, making for easy arrival and departure. After a long day out, it was so nice to be able to go straight up to my room and fall into bed! Staff are very helpful, and check-in was efficient and a breeze. The rooms are small, but very clean, with a capsule style bathroom. My room was facing the train station and I slept just fine.

Great location, bang next to the train station.
We signed up for the membership and got an early checkin and complimentary drinks too. Thanks to Diandra. The rooms (twin) were comfy, with a good view of the station and the bathrooms were clean. Highly recommended for smaller trips for friends or family. The breakfast service couple have been better.

The beds are really comfortable. It would be nice if there were more space, another chair or tables, to put things on.
We totally enjoyed the breakfast and the team of Lucilia. Great to get English breakfast and so many different other things. We would like to come to Ibis Cambridge again.

If you stay here make sure you have the pizza, Carolina created a pizza for me and have had 2 weeks of terrible food as you generally do in the UK, this was simply delicious. The hotel is basic but i was there for one night and this pizza made the night

The hotel is very handy for the station, so zero hassle on arrival by train. The down-side is that the station is not in the centre of the city. In addition to the hotels own basic restaurant, there are plenty of eateries adjacent. The breakfast is a comprehensive buffet including cooked food.

Overall, it's a typical Ibis experience, no frills but fully functional and efficient, with a more comprehensive breakfast than some.
The hotel is a 15 min walk from the city centre.

I would have preferred a softer pillow.

Two people in a double room, with lots of luggage for a European tour, would have to be tidy. The rooms are not huge.

Accommodation in Cambridge is expensive.

Location right by the station is super convenient.
The rooms are nice and clean and the beds are very comfortable
Nothing to complain about
The bed was really comfortable
great stay - great location

Excellent Only problem was shower which I found rather difficult and I tended to almost swamp the bathroom! Also lack of fridge in room.
See above

Room was very clean and ideal for the train station.
Check in was very quick and I felt rushed

Very excellent breakfast varies health balanced diet seem no problem at all
Hard bed mattress, no have chest drawers, where is pair of sofa
Good accessible for mobility people but should have ground floor because fire alert, never know who can't walk for downstairs emergency exit

Decor, everything we needed. Clean. Nice cafe.
Beds & pillows uncomfortable
Nice hotel, rooms and cafe.

Simple and close to train station.
Modular bathrooms+shower feel like a cheap plastic phone booth that's falling apart. Interesting concept though.

Super cozy atmosphere, with a great vibe. Pizzas that taste wonderful and are perfect for enjoying with the family. Very friendly service from the whole team, and especially Inês from bar chill#2. Will definitely be back
Excellent service by the employee Inês. Very dynamic space. Excellent location. Very relaxed and bright space. Excellent food and very good quality, especially the pizzas.

Stay at an Ibis anywhere and generally you know you're going to get a good, solid and consistent experience, all at a reasonable price. This one is no exception. Location is handy. Rooms are on the small side but comfortable, and room air conditioning is a nice luxury in a country where despite climate change bringing more hot days, many hotels still have no aircon. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. Breakfast buffet fine apart from rubbery scrambled eggs. We stayed three nights.

I cannot express enough how exceptional my experience was at IBIS Cambridge, and it's all thanks to the invaluable assistance provided by Clare. As a returning guest, I have always cherished my stays at this hotel due to its unparalleled convenience, being located right next to the train station, and its unbeatable value for money. The vibrant and lively coffee shop downstairs adds to the overall delightful ambiance, and the modern, well-equipped rooms are perfectly suited to my needs.

Nevertheless, my most recent visit stands out because of the impeccable service I received from Clare, the night manager at IBIS. On the 16th of July, I arrived at the hotel, only to realize to my dismay that I had mistakenly booked my stay for the 16th of August instead. Adding to my anxiety, it was a non-refundable reservation for a nine-day stay that I had already paid for. The thought of losing hundreds of pounds and having to rebook at full cost was distressing.

In my state of worry, I shared my predicament with the front desk staff, and Sussane demonstrated remarkable understanding and compassion. She advised me to book for one night while suggesting that I sort out the situation with Viki, the General Manager, the following morning. However, before Viki even had the chance to address my concern, Clare took it upon herself to resolve the issue that very night. She managed to change my reservation to the original intended dates, without any additional charges!

I am utterly grateful to Clare, Viki, and the entire IBIS team for going above and beyond to assist me in this challenging situation. Their promptness, empathy, and efficiency turned what could have been a stressful ordeal into a seamless and pleasant experience. Clare's exceptional customer service truly saved the day, reaffirming my appreciation for the hospitality provided by IBIS Cambridge. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a delightful stay, as the staff's dedication to guest satisfaction is truly second to none.

Staff member Lucilia made our stay much more pleasant, with her friendliness, professionalism and availability, I suggest a salary increase. Being an excellent professional management and her entire team. She helped me both at reception and in the breakfast room. Clean and new hotel.

I have stayed at many hotels closer to town over the years t double to $ and booked here only because the rest were booked out. Have to say , it was the best decision I made. This hotel is so nice, not for the frills of others but clean, friendly great location near train station and buses to town centre. Chilli Bar downstairs good for food and coffee special mention to Paul there for great customer service !

We enjoyed our stay, friendly staff, easy check in, clean room and good location.
The sights of cambridge are in walking distance. Would stay there again and recomened to friends.
One small observation, the bath towels were big and fluffy personaly would have appreciated a hand towel as well.
Check out time is noon which is a generous time

Really enjoyed our stay at the Ibis. It is right next to the train station which was perfect to drop our bags off as soon as we arrived. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious. Breakfast had a really good selection of continental and traditional and was served in a comfortable room overlooking the train station. There are also a couple of nice bars next to the hotel where we enjoyed evening drinks. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. Only thing to note is that it's about a 25 min walk into central Cambridge, but a nice walk so we didn't mind.

I used to really enjoy it, however, I find sometimes the staff can be rude, for example, I found my drink to be very strong and simply asked if more milk could be added ( considering it cost £4.10 I thought this a fair request ) however they refused and said that they would not do this, this was upsetting due to how expensive the latte was.

I hired a meeting room for a company team meeting recently. The facilities were first class. Clean, well presented and perfect for facilitating a small team meeting. The team were very helpful. It all went very smoothly.
The location was very good and the breakfast was very good to
Well located hotel. Very comfortable bed and very functional room. Very quiet too.

The location is really convenient for railway station, if you need to go to central Cambridge, just take a bus or walk like 25min. The staff is friendly and there are bar and cafe on the ground floor, also some food choices and Sainsbury's local just a few metres away.
The window couldn't be opened which I understand for safety reason, although a little bit lack of fresh air. The biggest problem is the hot water from shower wasn't warm at all, just slightly better than cold water. And it could be only opened for half amount.I guess maybe due to control of use of water, but the temperature wasn't warm enough at all. So I took an awful shower that night. Strangely, the tap water for the basin can be very warm, which is ok.
The price was very competitive with other nearby hotels

Very near station. Friendly welcome and a cheerful lounge and cafe bar at the entrance.
Breakfast with a view over the station square was good.    No view from the bedroom window.

The hotel is right next to the Station which is very nice if you arrive late at night. It is a fair but very do-able walk if one is visiting the University, with lots of lovely bakeries and coffee shops along the way. The room was very nice and clean. The decor is minimalist but the design is very clever. They happily stored our luggage for us after we had checked out, until we left on the train later in the day.
The in-house eating offering did not really appeal to us but there are quite a few eating places in the square around the hotel - however, many of these were closed by the time we arrived quite late at night.

Good location, easy access to station and city centre
The fan in the room above the door would hit the door hinge at the top of the door when it was on, which would sound as though someone was coming into the room, disrupting my sleep a lot of the time

I liked the well laid out room with space to work and stash stuff. It was perfect for a 1/2 night business trip.
Shower a bit weedy!
Close proximity to the train station and city centre.
Very clean room and friendly staff. Great value for money

Susanna on reception friendly, and helpful, and close to cambridge train station
Shame cafe shut at 10.45pm for drinks

Convenient for station.
Expensive, for accommodation so far from city centre.

The room was clean and comfortable and in its proximity to Cambridge Station was ideal for an overnight before moving on to Stansted Airport.
No obvious criticisms apart from the crudity of the wall decor throughout the hotel.

Cleaned, very central
No toilet brush

Good location. Simple room.
A bit noisy. The isolation wasn't great.
Excellent location. Hotel good in all aspects
Location and staff were great

Room was with Shower, hairdryer, eletric kettle and in a very quite area no outside noise. Enough space for luggages. Location was next to the train station, bus station, pubs, cafes and a supermarket. Breakfast included hot food (English Breakfast) and some cold food (Continental)
Breakfast
Conveniently located next to the station, but within walking distance of a good range of restaurants (Mill Road). Good sized rooms, excellent breakfast
clean and sufficient, convenient location right next to train station.

A great stay at the Ibis, ideal for the station (couldn’t hear any trains). It’s about a 25-30 min walk to the Centre which suited us, plenty of pubs and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was very good and so were the hotel staff, we parked in the Leisure car park (about a 10 min walk) where you get a discount if you’re staying at the Ibis. You need to ask for the car park discount code when you check out, you then scan it when you’re paying at the car park. Would stay here again.

We went to the Ibis yesterday for the Greek night and it was absolutely amazing! The music was great and we had a great night.
Good vibes , nice drinks and food. looking forward for the next one

Paul and Ines from the bar were amazing! Lucilia was a great host! We went to this Greek event and it was absolutely fantastic! 10/10! Chloe went the extra mile to ensure we had a booking for that night! Thank you all so much for this wonderful evening! 10/10

We attended an event with my friends, it was lovely. The food was very tasty and the atmosphere very friendly. Definitely suggest Ibis.  Lucilia was amazing and helped us with everything we needed. All the staff was amazing and super friendly!!

Highly recommended
Very welcoming, and informative staff, funky reception,diner and bar. Comfortable rooms all a stones throw from rail station and a mile from city centre.
There are pub diners, cafes, sainsburys and bus stops
Nearby
No complaints

Amazing welcome and check in thanks to Diandra. Beautiful girl and very helpful. The room was perfect for our stay , clean and had everything we need for a lovely stay. Next time I’m going to stay more time for sure. 10/10

Lovely pizzas at the Chill cafe. Raquel was very attentive and gave us orange slices in our water. Quiet and relaxing setting. Train information displayed, comfy seats. Didn’t try the hotel itself so can’t comment on that.
Popped in to chill for the first time in months. Had a bite to eat and a coffee. Served by Tammin who was most polite and welcoming. Planning on returning soon with family. Keep up the good work!

For a very long time now I’ve been coming to Chill lounge to finish work. I truly appreciate this place’s cleanliness, professionalism and of course its amazing coffee and super friendly staff! In particular Tammin who introduced me to the delicious chai latte!

Convenient Location - Close to Railway station.

BUT 
 It is very noisy with clanging doors from nearby rooms and the floors above and below. Seems like the bath bathroom modules have been poorly installed or designed so that the doors bang.
Thee room doors are badly sprung and slam unconsolably.
The room have very poor storage.
The dangling electric cables leading to the bedside lamps are potentially dangerous.
Quirky place right by the station, really convenient. Comfy bed, nice staff and nice vibe in the bar too.
Close to train station

Conveniently located for the rail station
No irons, you have to use an ironing room which is communal, breakfast not great
Breakfast was good

Super location, right at the Cambridge train station, with bus connections to everywhere in Cambridge.
Friendly staff, good vibe overall.

Room is spacious, bed is comfy, shower water pressure is strong.
Breakfast can be improved with more choices

Friendly staff and 24hr bar
I wish I had hangers
Very satisfied overall.

Handy location. Nice room , nice breakfast
Very noisy from the road outside, too near many noisy pubs especially Saturday night .room could be bigger

Near to the Cambridge Railway station, restaurants,bus station, supermarket
Nothing..everything perfect for me

The staff was amazing and the room was pretty big
The shower wasn’t really clean and it also had some sort of hook which made it impossible for me to take the shower head and place it as desired while showering
Very poor breakfasts. Little choice, if u vegan u gonna starve
A good location especially for train travel
Cleanliness, staff & service, property conditions & facilities, room comfort

Booked for a place to stay before and after attending a wedding. Hotel was in a great location for the station and for cafés and a Sainsbury's, allowing you to get a few essentials. Hotel was clean, modern and brilliantly designed to allow maximum space in a simple and elegant way. Especially impressed with the bathroom as so often they can be cramped and flood easily but this was great. Staff were friendly and helpful and I know the late opening of the bar kitchen was really helpful for my friends who arrived late after terrible train delays. Great hotel for a place to stay and explore the city
3rd time staying here. Perfect spot for us to explore Cambridge. First time having breakfast there. Plenty of choice and very fresh food.

Excellent hotel for a very reasonable price only complaint is usually Ibis hotels have a reduced rate for parking with NCP parks this one didnt,9 very exensive parking £29 from 3pm Saturday to 9am Sunday
A good location and good staff.
I didn't like the sausages
Cleanliness, staff & service, property conditions & facilities, room comfort
Ideal for trains and local transport
All good, great location
Easy check in

Only stayed one night as we were passing through Cambridge. The Ibis Cambridge Central Station is ideally located beside the main railway station and out room had a great view of the station and trains. The hotel is a 15 minutes walk from the main City Centre. The double room we had was very clean, and spacious. I will certainly stay here again on future visits to Cambridge.
I had beautiful sleep and very friendly staff Thank you

Very conveniently located next to the railway station and bus stops. A 20 minute walk into centre or U1, U2 bus for £2. Staff excellent. Bed comfortable. Housekeeping on this occasion not the best but adequate. Would definitely stay again.
Good! I enjoyed my stay there.

Perfect location, near to trains. Excellent staff. Good breakfast options. Needs recycling options. Aside from that, we would definitely stay here again. Discounted parking was a bit of a hike, but not terribly far of a walk
Very close to the station. Had a comfortable night. But bathroom very small and no hot water in the morning so had to have a cold shower. Extremely over priced given how basic the room was.

It maybe because we (my wife and I) don't travel frequently but we were not made aware that we had to insert our key card into a wall slot in order to activate the lights and air conditioning. It may also be an energy conservation initiative but there were only two large towels provided with the room and the shower only had warm water. We did appreciate that there were recycling bins in the hallway.

Standard hotel room, but being next to Cambridge Station makes it very convenient. Grocery store next door and several food trucks were next to the taxi stand. A bit far from the colleges, but not expensive to take a taxi.
Excellent staff, very convenient for station, quiet room on request, luggage store. Food options close by. Clean and comfortable room.

Good location; pleasant, helpful staff; clean and quiet. However, very basic room with no extras! Room lights and bathroom lights were connected, which was not helpful for bathroom use during the night (all the lights came on - not just the bathroom). There might have been a way to deal with this, but no explanation was provided of how they worked.
Bare bones, but very clean. No small towels or face cloths available.
Clean, convenient with great friendly staff
Located close to the train station but very quiet. Only negative is a disappointing shower.

The location is great next to the train station, pubs, shops, and restaurants. The room’s layout was odd. The bathroom was shaped like a pod, door was very squeaky. Bed was ok not the most comfortable. I felt a bit claustrophobic, our room was on the small side. We weren’t in the room that long but still felt tight. The a/c unit was great. I wouldn’t stay here again but it’s a excellent location.

Clean and comfortable, right next to train station with lots of good food options nearby. Helpful staff - if you need anything (like ice), just ask! With the free loyalty program (sign up as you check in), can get early check-in and safe luggage storage after check-out. Would definitely return.
Great location for the station and plenty of shops & eateries. Hotel staff very friendly & helpful and the room was immaculate.
Great choice, next to train station, decent restaurants and food trucks nearby. Good value for the money!
It was fantastic and the room was so clean and spacious

An excellent location a very short walk from the central train station. Surprisingly comfortable with air conditioning. Breakfast was very good, although with the awful machine coffee, now common in UK hotels. Staff very attentive and friendly.
Functional hotel with no frills. Close to train station.
Everything wad within walking distance
Comfortable and convenient
Convenient for transporting, train n city bus

It was good this time I’ve been there four times but honestly I was shocked when I ordered pizza I asked for olive oil the girls behind the counter saying we don’t have olive oil Sainsbury’s 50 seconds from the hotel how we eat pizza with out olive oil I was shocked
Great location for train station and town center also buses

Worse nights sleep I've had in a hotel for a long time. The beds were awful. I stayed in a twin room for 2 nights and each night I had the worst night's sleep waking up with back pain. At £200+ per night I've never felt so disappointed. I couldn't wait to leave. On the plus side, the location is great.
I would change nothing. Bring this kind of experience everywhere please.

The hotel was in a great location very close to the train station - it was raining when we arrived so we were glad about that! Staff were helpful and friendly and check in & check out was very quick and efficient. We had a room on the 4th floor - very clean with tea & coffee making facility, hairdryer, great TV and comfy bed. The bathroom was a bit different - bit like being on a cruise ship as it was more of a "pod" than an actual room. That said it had good toiletries and nice towels although we thought the shower was a bit basic. We feel it could have done with a separate hand towel though as once you'd used both bath towels you had to keep using damp towels until the next day! The restaurant staff were excellent - nothing was too much trouble. Plenty of food choices at the breakfast buffet but depending what time you arrived some of the hot food was a bit lukewarm. We enjoyed out 4 night stay at the Ibis and enjoyed our first visit to Cambridge.
Nice well maintained and convenient
Great location, fantastic breakfast buffet with many options, overall hotel was a bit like a store-brand citizen-m
Great location and immediate environment, supermarket, pub, greggs
I was desapointed about toilet paper my room 476 she couldn’t change it less than one meter left
Comfortable stay for one night...nothing special but definitely not terrible, paid for breakfast which was better than ok

Very close to railway station as well as to bus stop with lots of amenities close to the hotel. The breakfast was especially good and one of the breakfast team staff was AMAZING! Her name is Ella. Always greeted us with a smile and made special order poached eggs for us every morning.

Good basic no-frills hotel and an excellent breakfast. Very comfortable bed, which is what matters most. Not a great shower - rather soft and feeble, but nice and hot, and a strange wet room form of layout which meant the floor was a bit wet after use, but it was adequate. Take your own tissues and shower caps - as I said, it's basic. Very friendly staff and a nice coffee/bar area on the ground floor.
location good. access to taxi, buses and trains very convenient. Lack of parking could be a constraint
Amazing disability access and staff weee lovely and helpful. Lots of comfy places to work wnd relax. Thank you!
Nice and easy place to stay if you’re traveling by train.
Love the music-inspired vibe throughout. Lovely staff, great room and a perfect location. Look forward to coming back soon
